Text: What the—?!
Agh...!
What do you think, Epsilon?
Security seems lax, considering the situation.

Agreed. Compared to the dark knight we saw at
the cafe, the guards here are, to put it bluntly, wet
noodles.
Maybe this place isn't that important after all?

I can't rule out that possibility, but... Anyway,
we'll have to go a little deeper to find out.
...Beta.
Have you found something?

Not exactly. It's just that the air feels a little
different here.

It certainly has begun to feel more pleasant, hasn't
it?

Just a few minutes ago, it was damp and full of the
mossy stink of ancient ruins.

I'm gonna try to trace the flow of magic. Keep your
eyes on the area around us.
Please make it quick.

...There's a wide-open space up ahead, and inside
there's condensed magic scattered all over...and a
lot of it is moving.

When you say, "a space", I take it you mean a large
area within these ruins?
About how many do you sense?

I'd say roughly 30 or so. Also, there's one big one
amongst them as well.

This one seems to be sleeping. I think it's some
kind of monster.

Well the situation seems to be consistent with all
the warnings about a monster in the ruins.
But, what about the other 30?

Well, the only way we're gonna find out is if we go
and take a look for ourselves.
Let's be careful not to get spotted!
Those masks...!

Wait a minute! Wait a minute! I was right on the
money, wasn't I! This place IS being used to train
Templars!

I guess you could say that...your baseless
assumptions were right on target, weren't
they?
Despite the way you put it, facts are facts.

Within the Church, there is a warrior group whose
existence is kept secret from the public—the Templar.

What's more is that they integrate themselves into
everyday life, in order to go unnoticed. They're
quite brazen in how they hide themselves.

There's a projection that overlooks the entire site,
almost like a balcony.

I'll check out the surrounding area. Please stay on
the lookout.
You got it.

This artifact is...dangerous. It makes a sound
whenever magic is channeled through it.

It seems to be a megaphone used to give instructions
to those who are training.

I guess a lot of these sorts of artifacts would be
made here, as one would expect from an ancient
facility like this.

This stone slab is...also magical. It's made of
material that is constantly charged with magic...
It's gotta be quite valuable.

It looks like some kind of table—the phrases
inscribed are ones that appear frequently in
Church scripture!

What's this? Okay, hold it together—Ah! C-Could this
tablet be...!

I knew it... This is not just an ancient tablet with
scripture engraved on it!

This appears to be some sort of cipher that reacts
when magic is channeled through it!

It's for deciphering some kind of code that matches a
"key" to a corresponding phrase!
Hey Epsilon, you're gonna need to sit for—
...What the?!
Uwah—!!!

How could you not notice! Don't lose yourself just
because you found something interesting!

How could you not say anything?! You could've warned
me, you know!

Because at the volume I would need to get you to
notice me, we'd have every Templar in here on
us in a heartbeat!
Well you're being pretty loud now, aren't you?!
Because you're already shouting, so what's the point!

Intruders! We don't need the monster, we'll catch
them ourselves!
...You mean this ox monster is your idea of security?!
Epsilon! Let's make our way though the open area!
Are you crazy?! It's crawling with Templars!

That huge thing is blocking the exit, so this is our
only choice!
Grr...! This is getting desperate!
Hah!
They're coming right to us...perfect. Get 'em!
That thing jumped all the way here from over there?!
We gotta run, Epsilon!
Where are you going?!
Stop!!!
Whatever you do, don't stop moving!
Aaaaaah!!!
Ah! Beta! You idiot!
